title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - ISAF Deployment Enhancement

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to build the capacity of Romanias national military forces by improving their tactical effectiveness, survivability, and aerial surveillance capabilities for deployments to Afghanistan in support of ISAF. Equipment provided includes communications equipment, imaging devices, organizational clothing, individual combat equipment, weapons and accessories, and UAS ancillaries. The recipient units will be the 6th Special Forces Brigade and the 1st, 2nd, and 4th Infantry Divisions of the Romanian Land Forces.

title.narrative: Ministry of Defense Advisors Program

description.narrative: The Ministry of Defense Advisors (MoDA) program partners senior Department of Defense (DoD) civilian experts with foreign counterparts to improve ministerial capacity. title.narrative: Inter-European Air Forces Academy Mobile Training Team - Romania

description.narrative: This is a two-week course which provides an abbreviated version of the IESOS and IENCOA curriculum. It prepares NCOs and junior officers for more advanced leadership and management responsibilities. Students learn time and stress management, concepts of human behavior, teambuilding, critical thinking, effective communication, and leadership techniques, as well as implementing quality in the workplace. Experiential course activities challenge each student to apply curriculum concepts successfully and to influence group dynamics, cohesion, and effectiveness in a positive manner. By virtue of their international student body, IEAFA courses foster positive relationships between NATO and PfP members, as well as expanding students cultural knowledge and learning in a manner consistent with U.S. and NATO objectives.

title.narrative: Inter-European Air Forces Academy SNCO Mobile Course - Romania

description.narrative: This is a two-week course which provides an abbreviated version of the Senior Non-Cimmissioned Officer Academy curriculum. It prepares SNCOs for advanced leadership and management responsibilities. Students learn time and stress management, concepts of human behavior, teambuilding, critical thinking, effective communication, and leadership techniques, as well as implementing quality in the workplace. Experiential course activities challenge each student to apply curriculum concepts successfully and to influence group dynamics, cohesion, and effectiveness in a positive manner. By virtue of their international student body, IEAFA courses foster positive relationships between NATO and PfP members, as well as expanding students cultural knowledge and learning in a manner consistent with U.S. and NATO objectives.

title.narrative: Proliferation Security Initiative - Romanian Multilateral TTX

description.narrative: The Proliferation Security Initiative (PSI) is an international cooperative effort to stop trafficking in Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD), their delivery systems, and related materials to and from state and non-state actors of proliferation concern. DoD is the U.S. Governments operational lead for the PSI and works closely with other departments/agencies to conduct and participate in PSI exercises, workshops, training events, meetings and other activities. These activities demonstrate the commitment of participants to the PSI Statement of Interdiction Principles, test national capabilities to conduct air, ground, and maritime interdictions and increase understanding of PSI globally and within geographic regions.
